profileInfo.headline: Head Interdisciplinary Machine Learning Initiative (IMLI) · Associate Professor (Habib University) · xDean (FES GIKI) · Writer and Poet (Ibné Muneeb)
profileInfo.topSkillsByEndorsements: LaTeX, Matlab, Signal Processing, Mathematical Modeling, Simulations
profileInfo.about:
“I bring four things to a role I take - a passion for quality education (for all), academic leadership, proven ability for collaborative research, and a deep love for mathematics, machine learning, and signal processing.”

#Head Interdisciplinary Machine Learning Initiative (IMLI) · xDean Faculty of Engineering Sciences (GIKI) · Writer and Poet (Ibné Muneeb).

#Ph.D. (Engineering) in Mathematical Statistics - Centre for Mathematical Sciences, Lund University, Sweden (awarded: 2011).

#Major areas of interest & strength - Mathematics, Machine Learning, and Statistical Signal Processing.

#Extensive International Experience in Academia and Industry - Full-time: GIK Institute (4 years), Jouf University (2 years), Lund University (8 years), Ericsson Research (4 years). Visiting Researcher: King’s College London, University of Ljubljana, CASE. Project Collaborations/Fundings: Swedish Defense Research Agency, Wellcome Trust, Senfusion, Careem, SUPARCO.

#Roles Served In - Current: Associate Professor (GIKI). Past: Dean (GIKI), Assistant Professor (Jouf University), Senior Researcher (Ericsson Research), Doctoral Staff and Researcher (Lund University), Research Assistant (KFUPM).

#Academic Leadership - As Dean FES (GIKI), oversaw extensive modernization and implementation of curricula and procedures for undergraduate program (Engineering Sciences), graduate programs (Applied Mathematics & Applied Physics), and service courses (Mathematics and Physics). Established a number of functional units including Pedagogy & Training, Outreach, Advisory, OBE, Graduate Program Quality, Alumni & Industry, Talks and FYPs Unit, each with its specific mandate and tasks. Oversaw preparation of first-ever set of handbooks in the faculty, including Best Practices in Course Management, Best Practices for TAs/Lab Staff, Handbook for Student Advisor, Handbook for Alumni Mentors, FYP Handbook, and Graduate Students’ Handbook. Currently contributing to national BS and MS curricula as Member HEC NCRC (Mathematics). 
 
#Role as a Teacher - Taught 12 courses on undergraduate and graduate level in Sweden, Pakistan, and Saudi Arabia, including Mathematics for Machine Learning, Random Processes, Estimation & Detection Theory, Probability, Wave Propagation, and Signals & Systems.  

#Role as a Researcher - Active in academic and industrial research as supervisor, Co-PI, and team member. Established own interdisciplinary research group at GIKI. Research output includes multiple Journal Articles, Conference Articles, International Patents, Book Chapter, and Graduate Students.

updates.postText:
I often find myself giving [mostly solicited] advice to students and friends on how to make a good CV. For easy referencing, just thought of collecting the most critical pointers here, under the title:

"[Probably the Shortest] Workshop on Preparing a Good CV and Preparing Yourself for a Good CV"

So here goes:

A. Attractive by Design!

1. The document should appeal to the eyes without turning into an infographic.

2. Most relevant information the employer may want to look at should be the easiest to spot.

3. [Unless really forced to] Don't feel bound to any length or title. E.g., you could have a mix of a cover letter and brief CV as one document, and a full CV as another. And by all means, make a long CV, as long as you provide an executive summary.

B. Savoury Bits!

1. Good design will get you a first glance, but to really captivate the evaluator you will need to show true passion and calibre - hence the second part of the workshop "Preparing Yourself for a Good CV".

2. Good organisations prefer people who are reflective, self-aware, passionate, and show clarity of purpose. Make sure you cultivate these in yourself over time as it will then become easier to write a truly meaningful statement about yourself and your purpose (making it the strongest point of your CV).

3. Smart employers look for evidence. You say you have passion for xyz? Great, do you have something to show for it on your CV? Where's your passion project (link, repository, channel, article, prototype)? You say you are good at this or that? Where's the marked achievement (award, funding, trophy, medal, publication)?

4. Excellent employers look for legacy. It's not enough to say what experience your previous jobs, community, or university gave you. What did you give them? Founded a new club at college? Introduced diversity training at work? Developed more efficient ways-of-working with the team? Extensively expanded the client base?

5. Narrative matters. See if you can connect various sections with a narrative without turning the CV into a novel. The best connecting narrative would be your claimed purpose and passion. 

6. Finally, don't forget the human touch. What makes you interesting?

Pop Quiz: Try to find some of these elements in the attached sample.

PS:
- The list above is neither exhaustive nor universal. Many ways to reach the same goal.
- I personally prefer to send a brief CV which kind of also serves as a cover letter (as in this post) and a full CV (20 pages, listing all the projects, publications, supervised theses etc. with sufficient detail). Depending on the job, your field, and your experience, a separate full CV may not even be needed.

FULL Lecture Recordings: 

https://lnkd.in/dJeEvvSi

Dear Friends,

As some of you know, apart from my fascination with science, modern tech, and mathematics, I have great love for letters (with all the aspects of humanities and arts they encompass) and write under the pen name Ibné Muneeb. 

On that note, I am pleased to share with you my fifth work of poetry titled "Subh-e-Watan". 

Link to e-book/pdf:

https://lnkd.in/d_gKJr3w

Some of my previous works can be found/read on Rekhta.org (ping me if you'd like to get the e-books).

https://lnkd.in/dwRGTXXY

Salams,
Naveed (Ibné Muneeb)

As educators, one of our key goals is to "seed" the right thoughts and questions in the young minds.

Welcoming young delegates to GIKI as Advisor GIKI Science Society.

Faculty of Engineering Sciences is Pleased to Present a Thoroughly Upgraded Curriculum Incorporating Latest Engineering Trends in Photonics, Chip Design, Simulation, and Machine Learning. 

Nearly all specialization course contents have been redone from scratch, specialization labs increased, and new electives heavily cross listed with courses from other faculties in Data Science, AI, Blockchain, Logistics Planning, Nanotech, and IC Design. 

Additional Features (Institute-Wide): 

GIKI's overall first year has been carefully revised to include practice/supervised sessions on Critical Thinking, Expository Writing, and Communication Skills.

Introductory AI, Makers Lab, and topics in Environment are now taught from first year (and the first year has been made common for all engineering and computing programs).

Several new scholarships introduced.

https://giki.edu.pk/fes/

Admissions Portal:
https://lnkd.in/gUa5WA5

posts.content: Senior HW and Firmware experts in my network, please check these opportunities to help us shape the future of wireless 🚀!

author.name: Bengt Lindoff
author.info: Chief Systems Architect at BeammWave AB

postedAt.postedAgoText: 1 day ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

repost.content:
🚀 We’re hiring senior talent to shape the future of wireless!
BeammWave is developing a disruptive mmWave digital beamforming architecture. To take our mature technology to high-volume production, we are now strengthening our team in Lund with three (and more..) senior roles:
🔹 Senior Digital ASIC Designer – driving ASIC design from architecture to volume production
🔹 Senior ASIC/FPGA Verification & Test Engineer – ensuring robust verification and lab validation
🔹 Senior Firmware Architect & Developer – building real-time embedded firmware
At BeammWave, you’ll join an ambitious team at the intersection of system architecture, RF, ASIC, and embedded software – working hands-on with cutting-edge technology in a collaborative and innovative environment.
📍 Location: Ideon Science Park, Lund, Sweden
👉 Are you ready to take a senior role in shaping the next generation of wireless?
Apply now and be part of our journey: https://lnkd.in/gbtDFXAc

#Hiring #5G #ASIC #FPGA #Firmware #EngineeringJobs #Lund #Wireless

author.name: Naveed Razzaq Butt
author.info: Head Interdisciplinary Machine Learning Initiative (IMLI) · Associate Professor (Habib University) · xDean (FES GIKI) · Writer and Poet (Ibné Muneeb)

postedAt.postedAgoText: 1 day ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

posts.content:
Mathematics for Machine Learning | Naveed R. Butt | Course Slides | Set-8 | Linear Algebra (Part I)

Topics Covered:

- What math shows up in ML?

- Poetry of mathematics
---- Mathematical entities (sets, numbers, tensors,...) and their rules of engagement ("operators")
--- Important properties of various sets and why are we interested in them (closure, inverse, identity, commutative...)

- Multiverse of mathematics: Mathematical Structures (Algebraic, Metric,...)
--- Creating sets of objects with sets of features and laws.
--- Groups - Abelian, General Linear
--- Vector Space

- A Game of knowns (and unknowns)
--- One unknown, one linear equation
--- One unknown, no equation (underdetermined)
--- One unknown, two equations, and a scam (overdetermined but consistent)
--- One unknown, two equations, and a lie (overdetermined and inconsistent)
--- Linear dependence and true worth ("rank") of a system of equations

- In ML, we almost always work with overdetermined inconsistent systems of equations (why?)
--- And this leads to the need for "estimation": Least Squares, Min-Norm etc.

- From points (one unknown) to lines (two unknowns) to planes (three unknowns) to hyperplanes (more than three unknowns)

- From linear equations to matrices
--- Matrix operations, inverse, transpose, symmetry

postedAt.postedAgoText: 6 days ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

posts.content:
𝗨𝗻𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗱 𝗚𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝘆

Habib University stands as Pakistan’s most generous higher education institution. The incoming 𝗖𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟵 has received the highest number of scholarships and financial aid awards in our history—with 𝟴𝟲% of students supported. Backed by over $𝟯𝟮 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 disbursed since 2014, this level of support reflects our ongoing commitment to ensuring that access to quality education is driven by talent and dedication—not financial means.

#HabibUniversity #ShapingFutures #ReshapingPhilanthropy #UnmatchedGenerosity #Classof2029

postedAt.postedAgoText: 1 month ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

posts.content:
Meet haya imtiaz, a Communication and Design graduate from the Class of 2025, whose thesis transformed a personal gap into a playful solution. Raised in Dubai, Haya understood 𝗨𝗿𝗱𝘂, but never formally learned it. That changed at Habib, where a 𝗟𝗶𝗯𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘂𝗹𝘂𝗺 course sparked her journey from hesitant reader to language innovator.

Her final-year thesis project, 𝗗𝗶𝗯𝗶: 𝗛𝘂𝗿𝘂𝗳 𝗔𝗯𝗮𝗱 𝗘𝗱𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, is a play-based Urdu learning console for children aged 5–9. With tactile controls, joyful visuals, and culturally rooted games, Dibi turns screen time into hands-on language learning.

At Habib University, students like Haya are empowered to transform personal experiences into 𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘃𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲, 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗰𝘁-𝗱𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗻 𝘀𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 that contribute meaningfully to society.

Learn more about Dibi and Haya’s journey as penned by her, here: https://lnkd.in/dqVxqN5v 

#HabibUniversity #StudentInnovation #DibiProject #UrduLearning #ThesisToImpact #ShapingFutures

𝗛𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗯 𝗨𝗻𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗪𝗲𝗹𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘀 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗙𝗮𝗹𝗹 2025
 
Habib university is excited to welcome Dr. Naveed Razzaq Butt to 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗘𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 as an Associate Professor.

With a 𝗣𝗵.𝗗. 𝗶𝗻 𝗠𝗮𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗟𝘂𝗻𝗱 𝗨𝗻𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘁𝘆, Sweden, and over 20 years of combined academic and industrial experience across Sweden, the UK, Saudi Arabia, and Pakistan, Dr. Butt brings a wealth of expertise in 𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗺𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝘄𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴.

This fall, Dr. Butt is teaching 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮 𝗦𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗘𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗖𝗶𝗿𝗰𝘂𝗶𝘁 𝗔𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘀𝗶𝘀, empowering his students with knowledge critical to excelling in today’s world.

#HabibUniversity #HabibFaculty #ShapingFutures #LiberalArtsExcellence
